grades.cashewColor: white / pale ivory light ash
grades.description: WW-180 cashews are the largest type of cashew and are considered the best grade. They are also known as the King of Cashews because they are larger, have superior taste, and are more expensive than other cashews.
grades.remark: Remarks: Kernels shall be completely free from infestation, insect damage,  mould rancidity, adhering testa and objectionable extraneous matter.Scraped and partially shrivelled kernels also permitted provided such scraping/shrivelling does not affect the characteristic shape of the kernel.

grades.cashewColor: White/pale ivory or light ash. Kernels broken cross-wise (evenly or unevenly) naturally attached
grades.remark: Kernels shall be completely free from infestation, insect damage, mould rancidity, adhering testa and objectionable extraneous matter. Scraped and partially shrivelled kernels also permitted provided such scraping/shrivelling does not affect the characteristic shape of the kernel.

grades.cashewColor: White/pale ivory or light ash. Kernels Split naturally lengthwise
grades.remark: Kernels shall be completely free from infestation, insect damage, mould rancidity, adhering testa and objectionable extraneous matter. Scraped and partially shrivelled kernels also permitted provided such scraping/shrivelling does not affect the characteristic shape of the kernel.

grades.cashewColor: White/pale ivory or light ash
grades.cashewCount: Kernels broken into more than two pieces andnot passing through 4 mesh 16 SWG sieve/4.75mm.I.S.Sieve
grades.remark: Kernels shall be completely free from infestation, insect damage, mould rancidity, adhering testa and objectionable extraneous matter. Scraped and partially shrivelled kernels also permitted provided such scraping/shrivelling does not affect the characteristic shape of the kernel.

grades.cashewColor: White/pale ivory or light ash

grades.remark: Kernels shall be completely free from infestation, insect damage, mould rancidity, adhering testa and objectionable extraneous matter. Scraped and partially shrivelled kernels also permitted provided such scraping/shrivelling does not affect the characteristic shape of the kernel.
